pull.title: ci: Cache package manager install step
pull.body: Use the local podman or docker image cache to skip the slow `apt` step

issue.title: ci: Use containerfiles?
issue.body:
containerfiles have the advantage that they can be cached locally, so for example an `apt` operation in an image layer is faster to retrieve from the (local) cache than to run vanilla.

Converting the ci system to those is non-trivial, because it uses a lot of env vars, different configs, and numerous per-config hacks.

My understanding of docker is limited, but to pass env vars into a containerfile would require using `ARG` in the file, as well as code to pass in the ARG at runtime via the command line. For hundreds of args, this should be possible, but verbose, which is why I haven't looked at it yet.

events.body:
This isn't used by Cirrus, because I want to test/settle this a bit more. 

However, by the one task that runs on my infra, it gives a ~1min speedup: https://cirrus-ci.com/task/5552889800687616


Also, locally it seems to work:


```
podman image ls --all | grep localhost
localhost/ci_native_fuzz_valgrind              latest        5867fa661f2d  About an hour ago  1.08 GB
localhost/ci_native_tidy                       latest        2196c8dd7b51  2 hours ago        2.03 GB
localhost/ci_native_fuzz_msan                  latest        01047aa4c1ba  7 hours ago        818 MB
localhost/ci_win64                             latest        a21797b76dc0  7 hours ago        2.11 GB
localhost/ci_native_msan                       latest        621b2eb71e9c  8 hours ago        818 MB
localhost/ci_native_qt5                        latest        e8b0920ad207  9 hours ago        910 MB
localhost/ci_native_nowallet_libbitcoinkernel  latest        2af70303446f  10 hours ago       693 MB
localhost/ci_native_fuzz                       latest        31668cc3f135  12 hours ago       989 MB
localhost/ci_macos_cross                       latest        8bf17e6b9640  12 hours ago       526 MB
localhost/ci_i686_centos                       latest        f200c770cd17  13 hours ago       913 MB
localhost/ci_arm_linux                         latest        e8f8098d02d7  14 hours ago       1.34 GB
localhost/ci_native_tsan                       latest        d85e2a3cecb5  15 hours ago       843 MB
localhost/ci_i686_multiprocess                 latest        18f976e245b7  16 hours ago       881 MB
localhost/ci_s390x                             latest        008df12fecb7  17 hours ago       939 MB

ci: Cache package manager install step

events.message: ci: Cache package manager install step

events.body: (For what it's worth, I'm an ACK as-is because this PR represents a strict improvement over what we have now.)

ACK fa486de212108b4609d7c247d2a578f0b4df9703 ([`jamesob/ackr/26976.1.MarcoFalke.ci_cache_package_manager`](https://github.com/jamesob/bitcoin/tree/ackr/26976.1.MarcoFalke.ci_cache_package_manager))

Ran `./ci/test_run_all.sh`, container built successfully. `DOCKER_BUILDKIT=1` is cool.

Testing this locally, and it seems to be working as expected.
Building on the first run takes ~70s to build the container:
```bash
Creating ubuntu:22.04 container to run in
[+] Building 73.3s (9/9) FINISHED                                                                                                                                                                                   
 => [internal] load build definition from test_imagefile        
```

Subsequent runs take ~0s:
```bash
Creating ubuntu:22.04 container to run in
[+] Building 0.1s (9/9) FINISHED                                                                                                                                                                                    
 => [internal] load build definition from test_imagefile    
```

issue.title: ci: Use Cirrus CI dockerfile env
issue.body:
Currently the CI env has many intermittent issues:

* The Ubuntu package servers are frequently down
* Occasionally other stuff is down, such as dnf, pip, or the android sdk
* Installing packages is slower than downloading them, at least on Cirrus, which has a fast download speed

Fix all issues by using the Cirrus CI dockerfile env.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,10 @@
+ARG CI_IMAGE_NAME_TAG
+FROM ${CI_IMAGE_NAME_TAG}
+
+ARG FILE_ENV
+ENV FILE_ENV=${FILE_ENV}
+
+COPY ./ci/retry/retry /usr/bin/retry
+COPY ./ci/test/00_setup_env.sh ./${FILE_ENV} ./ci/test/01_base_install.sh /ci_base_install/ci/test/
+
+RUN ["bash", "-c", "cd /ci_base_install/ && set -o errexit && source ./ci/test/00_setup_env.sh && ./ci/test/01_base_install.sh"]
comments.body: To get even more of a speedup, wouldn't we want to move these steps into `RUN` commands earlier in the Dockerfile, and then just generate a few separate images on the basis of `CI_IMAGE_NAME_TAG`/`FILE_ENV`?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,10 @@
+ARG CI_IMAGE_NAME_TAG
+FROM ${CI_IMAGE_NAME_TAG}
+
+ARG FILE_ENV
+ENV FILE_ENV=${FILE_ENV}
+
+COPY ./ci/retry/retry /usr/bin/retry
+COPY ./ci/test/00_setup_env.sh ./${FILE_ENV} ./ci/test/01_base_install.sh /ci_base_install/ci/test/
+
+RUN ["bash", "-c", "cd /ci_base_install/ && set -o errexit && source ./ci/test/00_setup_env.sh && ./ci/test/01_base_install.sh"]
comments.body: The packages are defined in FILE_ENV, so RUN needs to be after FILE_ENV

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,10 @@
+ARG CI_IMAGE_NAME_TAG
+FROM ${CI_IMAGE_NAME_TAG}
+
+ARG FILE_ENV
+ENV FILE_ENV=${FILE_ENV}
+
+COPY ./ci/retry/retry /usr/bin/retry
+COPY ./ci/test/00_setup_env.sh ./${FILE_ENV} ./ci/test/01_base_install.sh /ci_base_install/ci/test/
+
+RUN ["bash", "-c", "cd /ci_base_install/ && set -o errexit && source ./ci/test/00_setup_env.sh && ./ci/test/01_base_install.sh"]
comments.body: I'm sorry, shouldn't be reading this before the caffeine has hit; I misread `RUN` here for `ENTRYPOINT`.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -33,7 +33,12 @@ if [ -z "$DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST" ]; then
 
   # the name isn't important, so long as we use the same UID
   LOCAL_USER=nonroot
-  ${CI_RETRY_EXE} docker pull "$CI_IMAGE_NAME_TAG"
+  DOCKER_BUILDKIT=1 ${CI_RETRY_EXE} docker build \
+      --file "${BASE_ROOT_DIR}/ci/test_imagefile" \
+      --build-arg "CI_IMAGE_NAME_TAG=${CI_IMAGE_NAME_TAG}" \
+      --build-arg "FILE_ENV=${FILE_ENV}" \
+      --tag="${CONTAINER_NAME}" \
+      "${BASE_ROOT_DIR}"
comments.body: Do we have good confidence that in Cirrus environments, local build caches will persist? If not, we'll hit slowdowns because pulling from registries is about as fast as it gets.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -33,7 +33,12 @@ if [ -z "$DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST" ]; then
 
   # the name isn't important, so long as we use the same UID
   LOCAL_USER=nonroot
-  ${CI_RETRY_EXE} docker pull "$CI_IMAGE_NAME_TAG"
+  DOCKER_BUILDKIT=1 ${CI_RETRY_EXE} docker build \
+      --file "${BASE_ROOT_DIR}/ci/test_imagefile" \
+      --build-arg "CI_IMAGE_NAME_TAG=${CI_IMAGE_NAME_TAG}" \
+      --build-arg "FILE_ENV=${FILE_ENV}" \
+      --tag="${CONTAINER_NAME}" \
+      "${BASE_ROOT_DIR}"
comments.body: Based on the docs, probably yes. Though, this can be investigated in the follow-up that actually switches over Cirrus. For now I've decided to postpone it to have this settle first.
